A view that handles a specific case of enum state in a
A Composable Architecture-friendly wrapper around
that simplifies working with
collections of state.
A store represents the runtime that powers the application. It is the object that you will pass
around to views that need to interact with the application.
Initializes a reducer that runs the given child reducer against a slice of parent state and
actions.
A
is an object that can observe state changes and send actions. They are most
commonly used in views, such as SwiftUI views, UIView or UIViewController, but they can be used
anywhere it makes sense to observe state or send actions.
A view that covers any cases that aren’t addressed in a
The Composable Architecture (TCA, for short) is a library for building applications in a consistent
and understandable way, with composition, testing, and ergonomics in mind. It can be used in
SwiftUI, UIKit, and more, and on any Apple platform (iOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS).
Integrating the Composable Architecture into a SwiftUI application.
Embeds a child reducer in a parent domain that works on a case of parent enum state.

into a
so that its state can be observed
by a view builder.
A view that safely unwraps a store of optional state in order to show one of two views.
